name: Rifle, Experimental (XR-3)
description: Experimental version of the rifle.A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Carbine, Experimental (XC-3)
description: Experimental version of the carbine.The carbine is a shorter version of the rifle.

name: Hunting Carbine, Heavy, Experimental (XHHC-3)
description: Experimental version of the heavy hunting carbine. The heavy hunting carbine is designed with large game as its targets.

name: Rifle, Early (ER-4)
description:
Early version of the rifle.

A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Battle Rifle, Experimental (XBR-4)
description: Experimental version of the battle rifle. Battle rifles are designed for the battlefield by soldiers. It is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at the limit of unaided vision (~1000 meters).

name: Rifle, Prototype (PR-4)
description: Prototype version of the rifle. A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Rifle, Medium, Early (EMR-4)
description: Prototype of the medium rifle.A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Dart Rifle, Medium, Experimental (XMDR-4)
description: Experimental version of the medium dart rifle. The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a Tranq dose into the target.

name: HR-5 Hunting Rifle (HR-5)
description: The hunting rifle is a general purpose long-arm used for hunting.

name: Rifle (R-5)
description: A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Rifle, Basic (BR-5)
description: Basic version of the rifle. A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Battle Rifle (BR-6)
description: Battle rifles are designed for the battlefield by soldiers. The weapon is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at the limit of unaided vision (~1000 meters).

name: Rifle, Improved (ImR-6)
description: Improved version of the rifle. A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game.

name: Rifle, Sniper (SnR-6)
description: The sniper rifle is designed for shooting enemy targets at extreme range.

name: Dart Rifle, Light (LtDR-6)
description: Light version of the dart rifle. The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a Tranq dose into the target.

name: Rifle, Light, Early (ELtSpR-6)
description: Early version of the light splat rifle.The weapon is a multi-barrel slightly diverging configuration. Each barrel is loaded with several projectiles and their associated propellants. Each pull of the trigger fires one round from each of the barrels.

name: AR-7 Assault Rifle (AR-7)
description: The assault rifle is designed for use by soldiers on the battlefield. The weapon is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at moderate ranges (~500 meters). It is capable of firing bullets and explosive projectiles.

name: Combat Rifle (CR-7)
description: The combat rifle is designed for use in combat by soldiers. It is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at relatively short ranges (~150 meters) using explosive projectiles.

name: Splat Rifle (SpR-7)
description: The splat rifle is a multi-barrel slightly diverging configuration. Each barrel is loaded with several projectiles and their associated propellants. Each pull of the trigger fires one round from each of the barrels.

name: Poison Dart Rifle, Heavy, Improved (ImHPR-7)
description: Improved version of the heavy poison dart rifle.The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a poison dose into the target.

name: Poison Dart Rifle, Heavy, Sniper (SnHPR-7)
description: Sniper version of the heavy poison dart rifle. This version of the rifle is optimized for accuracy at extended ranges.

name: Anti-Designator Rifle (aDR-8)
description: Anti-designator rifle.

name: Anti-Designator Survival Rifle, Basic (BaDSR-8)
description: Basic version of the anti-designator survival rifle.

name: Combat Rifle, Heavy, Standard (StdHCR-8)
description: Standard version of the heavy combat rifle. The combat rifle is designed for use in combat by soldiers. It is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at relatively short ranges (~150 meters) using explosive projectiles.

name: Accelerator Rifle, Medium, Prototype (PMAcR-8)
description: Prototype version of the medium accelerator rifle. The weapon fires a projectile at a low initial velocity; after it leaves the barrel, an internal charge accelerates the bullet to greater velocities. Accelerator weapons have low recoil and are well adapted to zero-G environments.

name: Assault Rifle, Medium, Remote (RMAR-8)
description: Remote-controlled version of the medium assault rifle. The assault rifle is designed for use by soldiers on the battlefield. The weapon is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at moderate ranges (~500 meters). It is capable of firing bullets and explosive projectiles.

name: Accelerator Rifle (AcR-9)
description: The weapon fires a projectile at a low initial velocity; after it leaves the barrel, an internal charge accelerates the bullet to greater velocities. Accelerator weapons have low recoil and are well adapted to zero-G environments.

name: Rifle, Obsolete (ObR-9)
description: Obsolete version of the rifle.

name: Anti-Designator Hunting Rifle, Sniper (SnaDHR-9)
description: Sniper version of the anti-designator hunting rifle.

name: Hunting Rifle, Disposable, Alternate (AltDHR-9)
description: Alternate version of the disposable hunting rifle. A long-arm used by soldiers in combat and sportsmen in pursuit of game. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Battle Rifle, Disposable, Target (TDBR-9)
description: Target version of the disposable battle rifle. Battle rifles are designed for the battlefield by soldiers. It is optimized for accuracy and is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at the limit of unaided vision (~1000 meters). This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Dart Rifle, Obsolete (ObDR-10)
description: Obsolete version of the dart rifle. The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a Tranq dose into the target.

name: Laser Rifle, Target (TLR-10)
description: Target version of the laser rifle. This version of the laser rifle is optimized for accuracy.

name: Anti-Designator Battle Rifle, Remote (RaDBR-10)
description: Remote-controlled version of the anti-designator battle rifle.

name: Anti-Designator Poison Dart Rifle, Remote (RaDPR-10)
description: Remote-controlled version of the anti-designator poison dart rifle. The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a poison dose into the target.

name: Anti-Designator Poison Dart Rifle, Sniper (SnaDPR-10)
description: Sniper version of the anti-designator poison dart rifle. This version of the weapon has been optimized for accuracy at extended ranges.

name: Anti-Designator Splat Rifle, Alternate (AltaDSpR-11)
description: Alternate version of the anti-designator splat rifle. The weapon is a multi-barrel slightly diverging configuration. Each barrel is loaded with several projectiles and their associated propellants. Each pull of the trigger fires one round from each of the barrels.

name: Gauss Rifle, Recoilless, Experimental (XRGR-11)
description: Experimental version of the recoilless gauss rifle. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects.

name: Poison Dart Rifle, Snub, Obsolete (ObSnPr-11)
description: Obsolete version of the snub dart rifle. The dart rifle fires a small injector projectile which on contact injects a poison dose into the target.

name: Assault Rifle, Vheavy, Obsolete (ObVhAR-11)
description: Obsolete version of the very heavy assault rifle. The assault rifle is designed for use by soldiers on the battlefield. The weapon is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at moderate ranges (~500 meters). It is capable of firing bullets and explosive projectiles.

name: GR-12 Gauss Rifle (GR-12)
description: The gauss rifle electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects

name: Survival Rifle, Disposable, Obsolete (ObDSR-12)
description: Obsolete version of the disposable survival rifle. A long-arm designed for use in survival situations. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Accelerator Rifle, Light, Advanced (AltAcR-12)
description: Advanced version of the light accelerator rifle. The weapon fires a projectile at a low initial velocity; after it leaves the barrel, an internal charge accelerates the bullet to greater velocities. Accelerator weapons have low recoil and are well adapted to zero-G environments.

name: Gauss Carbine (GC-12)
description: The gauss carbine electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects The gauss carbine is smaller in size and lighter in weight than the gauss rifle.

name: Splat Carbine, Disposable, Modified (ModDSpC-12)
description: Modified version of the disposable splat carbine. The weapon is a multi-barrel slightly diverging configuration. Each barrel is loaded with several projectiles and their associated propellants. Each pull of the trigger fires one round from each of the barrels. The weapon is smaller and lighter than the rifle version. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: ADCR-13 Advanced Disposable Combat Rifle, Disposable, Advanced (ADCR-13)
description: Advanced version of the disposable combat rifle. The combat rifle is designed for use in combat by soldiers. It is characterized by an ability to hit person-size targets at relatively short ranges (~150 meters) using explosive projectiles. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Gauss Rifle, Vheavy, Sniper (SnVhGR-13)
description: Sniper version of the very heavy gauss rifle. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. This version of the weapon has been optimized for accuracy at extreme ranges.

name: BVlGR-13 Basic Vlight Gauss Rifle, Vlight, Basic (BVlGR-13)
description: Basic version of the very light gauss rifle. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects.

name: Laser Rifle, Disposable, Alternate (AltDLR-14)
description: Alternate version of the laser rifle. The weapon fires a coherent beam of photons at the target. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Accelerator Carbine, Disposable, Modified (ModDAcC-14)
description: Modified version of the disposable accelerator carbine. The weapon fires a projectile at a low initial velocity; after it leaves the barrel, an internal charge accelerates the bullet to greater velocities. Accelerator weapons have low recoil and are well adapted to zero-G environments. The carbine version of the weapon is shorter and lighter than its rifle counterpart. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Gauss Rifle, Disposable, Target (TDGR-15)
description: Target version of the disposable gauss rifle. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Anti-Designator Laser Carbine, Modified (ModaDLC-15)
description: Modified version of the anti-designator laser carbine. The carbine version of the weapon is shorter and lighter than its rifle counterpart.

name: Gauss Carbine, Disposable, Basic (BDGC-15)
description: Basic version of the disposable gauss carbine. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Anti-Designator Gauss Carbine, Remote (RaDBC-16)
description: Remote-controlled version of the anti-designator gauss carbine. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. The carbine version of the weapon is shorter and lighter than its rifle counterpart.

name: Gauss Rifle, Disposable, Modified (ModDGR-17)
description: Modified version of the disposable gauss rifle. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. This version is constructed of relatively inexpensive materials and has a working lifetime measured in days.

name: Anti-Designator Gauss Carbine, Advanced (AaDGC-18)
description: Advanced version of the anti-designator gauss carbine. This weapon electromagnetically accelerates a projectile and spin stabilizes it through magnetic effects. The carbine version is shorter and lighter than its rifle counterpart.
